channel.title: Cutting off dc midi part / 5v power [solved]
channel.description:
I'm building an axoloti board into a small guitar amplifier and actually there is no space for the whole board, so I plan on removing the midi / dc part.
I plan on powering the board directly from a power bank with 5v. On wich pin should I feed it the 5v?

item.title: Cutting off dc midi part / 5v power [solved]
item.dc:creator: @Blindsmyth Simon
item.description:
@Blindsmyth wrote:

ah I should have used search before posting, this seems to be all I need:

Breaking apart the boards

Here's a legend for the 5 pin patch points JP2 and JP3, top view: [image] Merging two midi streams with a connection or simple logic is not possible, I mean, connecting an Arduino to MIDI in will not work in combination with the on-board MIDI input circuit.

Read full topic
item.source: Cutting off dc midi part / 5v power [solved]
